title: Electronic Travel Authority (Visitor) (subclass 976)
summary: This page provides information about the discontinued Electronic Travel Authority (Visitor) (subclass 976) visa. It explains that new applications are no longer accepted and provides details for existing visa holders about validity, conditions, rights, and obligations.

visa_details.description: Information for people who have already been granted this visa, including rights and obligations.

allowed_actions: enter Australia as many times as you want while the visa is valid
stay in Australia for up to three months on each visit

general_requirements: comply with all electronic travel authority conditions
specific_requirements: be free from tuberculosis when you travel to and enter Australia
volunteer work is allowed only if an Australian resident would not otherwise be paid to do the work; reimbursement for out-of-pocket expenses such as meals and accommodation is allowed
not study or train for more than three months
not have one or more criminal convictions for which you were sentenced to more than a total of 12 months (regardless of imprisonment)

notification_requirements.description: Visa holders must notify the department of certain personal changes.
must_notify: changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
notification_requirements.consequences_of_not_updating_passport: significant delays at the airport and possible denial of permission to board a plane

tools_and_resources.vevo: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) can be used to check visa status and entitlements.
